poem:
**The Fourth-Largest Dawn**

I read that California, while presidents vanish,  
packs its suitcase with sunlight and lithium  
and flies to Brazil like an unofficial uncle  
bringing charts, vows, and batteries—  
67% clean on nine mornings out of ten,  
the grid humming like a well-behaved choir.  
Even the ocean seems to listen,  
turning its waves a little slower.
